name: Log Show
description: Log Show is a command line utility used in macOS for viewing and querying system logs and activities recorded by Apple's unified logging system. It enables users and administrators to retrieve detailed information about system events and errors, making it crucial for system diagnostics and troubleshooting. The application supports querying logs by various attributes, including time periods, processes, and specific log levels, assisting in pinpointing the cause of system issues. It is especially useful for developers and system administrators who need to understand application behaviors and system responses over time.
